header.title: John McCririck health update: Pundit, 78, says he ‘won’t live to see another summer’
header.subtitle: JOHN MCCRIRICK has said he doesn’t believe he will be “alive this time next year” after the stress of losing his TV pundit job.
header.postText: 'The 78-year-old was the face of British horse racing until he was dropped from Channel 4 in 2012 after 28 years with the channel.', 'After John McCririck accused Channel 4 of ageism, he took the issue to an employment tribunal which he lost.', 'The star, who recently shed three-stone due to a severe bout to flu, said he now feels like a dinosaur following his job loss.', 'You 're a lost soul wandering around an environment you're no longer part of, he told Mail Online.', 'He continued: Life is empty.I don 't expect to be alive this time next year. It' s a question of slipping away.', 'I 've prepared the Booby [his wife, Jenny] for it. When I'm gone she knows exactly what to do and she 'll be fine.', 'John said he longs for a job and believes work is the most important thing.', 'I’m pining, he said. The broken heart is for a lost job. Work comes first.', 'Put that in capital letters. I always worked. It's the most important thing in life.', 'John recently revealed he has been suffering for much of the year with a chest infection but doctors are unsure of the cause.', 'Earlier this month, John shocked viewers on Big Brother’s Bit On The Side as he displayed a noticeably thinner frame.', 'After fans commented on his frail and gaunt appearance, John revealed he had been ill with the flu.', 'His representative told Express.co.uk: What started with flu in the New Year led to a serious chest infection, he is recovering well but slowly.', 'The star later appeared on This Morning to explain the reason for his new look.', 'John revealed his flu battle left him unable to speak for three months.', 'He spilled to hosts Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield: I'm getting better, slowly.I couldn’t speak for about three months. ', 'It really was awful, you get weaker and you’ re on antibiotics. ', 'The star also said he had been feeling depressed since losing his job six years ago as he said: I was over 19 stone, always remember you never see fat old men.', 'Ever since I was sacked in 2012 by Channel 4, when you stop working you feel depressed, you lose purpose in life.', 'He said to viewers: Don’ t retire.'
